title: Kate Moss lookalike tells how she overcame horror scars which left her a recluse
text:

A Kate Moss lookalike has told how she battled back from a horror crash that left her a recluse and scarred for life.

Denise Ohnona, who dreamed of gracing the catwalk when she was a teenager, thought her chance had been snatched from her when the car she was travelling in was hit by a bus.

Now, aged 39, she is finally living her dream.

And Denise has relived the horrifying moment she awoke to see the damage caused to her face by the collision.

She told the Liverpool Echo : "When I first looked in the mirror at my reflection in the hospital and saw my face I screamed.

"I started to cry as soon as I saw it."

(Image: Liverpool Echo WS)

(Image: Liverpool Echo WS)

Up to that point she had been working as a retail assistant.

She then received a call from a modelling agency offering her work - and the new opportunity meant she was able to sign to the firm and start a new career.

However on October 3, 1998, just days after the phone call, Denise found her dreams being crushed when she was involved in a horrific road accident.

She said: "I'd been in Liverpool during the day, but I decided to stay over which is something I never normally would do.

"My boyfriend at the time picked me up and the city was just like a ghost town, it felt like something was going to happen.

"We’d been in the car for about 30 seconds and then a double-decker bus crashed into us."

(Image: Liverpool Echo WS)

In the impact of the collision, Denise was forced across the passenger seating, hitting the steering wheel.

She said: "My head was pouring with blood, I was screaming. It was completely split in every way - my cheek was pretty much hanging off."

Tragically, the road accident left Denise with permanent facial scars.

Heartbroken by what had happened, she found herself becoming a recluse.

She said: "After the accident, I wasn't going out at all. I’d changed, I wasn't the person I used to be. I was put on anti-depressants.

"When I returned to my job at Next, I went to work in the office in the back - I couldn’t face people.

"I wouldn’t even go to the supermarket on my own, I needed someone to hold my hand.

"I never wanted to be in the limelight, my scars couldn’t even be covered up with makeup as I suffer from hypertrophic scarring."

(Image: Getty Images)

Over the next 15 years, Denise would start the slow progression back to normality.

She said: "I moved back home and joined the gym and started weightlifting. The biggest thing for me was quitting sugar."

Denise also became a mother to two girls.

She added: "People were still interested in me to do jobs as a model.

"My boyfriend would say to me that I should start it again, but I didn't want to with the scars on my face."

It would only be in January this year that Denise, now 39-years-old, would reignite her teenage dreams.

(Image: Liverpool Echo WS)

She said: " Alison Jackson’s [an English artist known for her look-alike photographs of celebrities] assistant found some pictures of me on social media.

"She asked me to do a flash mob with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle look-alikes and at the time I had a bit more confidence.

"I did the event and met some other look-alikes and thought 'I can do this'.

Since January, Denise has been inundated with booking and requests.

Explaining what she does, she said: "At look-alike events you get booked, turn up and pose for pictures with everyone.

"But it can be different, when I went to Germany, I was taken to a studio and had my makeup done and outfit changes for shooting different products.

"And for Halloween I’ve been booked for a yacht party in London."

As for the future, Denise said: "I never like to think too far ahead, I'm focusing on helping a homeless charity, but as long as people want me, I'll keep on doing it."
description: Denise Ohnona, 39, is reigniting her teenage dream of being a model after a devastating car crash changed her life forever
